newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares dip in sluggish trading.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares dip in sluggish trading.

text.p: Shanghai B shares dipped in sluggish trading on Tuesday with overseas investors returning to the market to sell their shares following yesterday's holiday, brokers said.
The index slipped 0.250 points or 0.51 percent to 48.476 points on volume of 5.0 million shares worth $2.1 million. Of 41 B shares, 37 traded with 15 down, 15 flat and seven up.
Brokers said the index moved down with weak support while overseas investors came back to the market to unwind their positions.

"Obviously overseas investors have lost confidence in the market and their attitude dominated the direction in which the market moved," one broker said. "They are expected to unwind their positions further in the short term."
"There is still the possibility of breaching the key 48-point support level although there is unlikely to be any drastic movements, either up or down," a second broker said.
Shanghai Steel Tube was the biggest loser on a correction following yesterday's big gains, falling $0.006 or 4.61 percent to $0.124 on volume of 5,500 shares.
Eastern Communications followed on overseas liquidation, falling $0.022 or 3.04 percent to $0.700 on volume of 366,000 shares.
Shanghai Yaohua Pilkington Glass traded the most on inter-institutional trading, ending unchanged at $0.490 on volume of 643,000 shares.
Shanghai A shares closed up on bullish market sentiment, and third tier stocks became the market buying focus, brokers said.
The A index rose 13.097 points or 1.29 percent to 1027.560 points on volume of 972.4 million shares worth 7.3 billion yuan.
The SSE 30 blue-chip index put on 27.709 points or 1.07 percent to 2615.986 points.
Shanghai Erfangji was the star on bargain-hunting, jumping 0.52 yuan or 10.83 percent to 5.32 yuan on volume of 14.5 million shares.
